content.description:
Solid traverse. Everything is good and relatively low to the ground.

Nice route to get some easy mileage on.
content.protection: Fairly low risk. A spotter wouldn't be a bad thing however. No crashpad needed for this one.
content.location: Located in the Motor Skills area. Start on The "O" Face and traverse right. Move past the dihedral and all the way to(or even past) the large crack and you're done.

content.description: Sit start on slopers down low continue up to top out. Short, stupid and a little fun on the side.
content.protection: perhaps a spotter, if anything, would be handy
content.location: Sit start the bulge on the gray rock right next to Human Sacrifice in the Decapitation area

content.description: Tough second move going from the crimp. When nearing the top, head left to avoid lichen-covered holds. The first few moves are killer, and gets a little easier close to the top
content.protection: Crash pad for sure on this one. Have an attentive spotter too.
content.location: At the Motor Skills area. It's right next to Snake Oil Salesman on the pink granite with red lichen on it. Start on the large flake to the right and move to a small crimp, then up.

content.description: Peculiar problem...fairly tight space between the route and a tree. The majority of this route is covered in moss and lichen (please keep it that way!!!!) but the top parts of the crimps have been brushed out, so holds are solid. Kinda balancy
content.protection: crashpad and spotter for sure. Don't fall into the tree! :P
content.location: in the Motor Skills area of Head Games.  follow the crimps up and over.

content.description: Start towards the bottom, and use the cracks and ledges to work your way up and over the mantel. No real crux here, but falling from the top could potentially suck
content.protection: Landing slopes downward, but there's some downed trees set in place to hold a few pads in place. Either way, have a spotter to keep you from taking a ride down the hill should you fall
content.location:
The O Face is located around the side of Head Games at Motor Skills and begins at the very left side of the rock.  A deer trail can be followed into this area.

Getting down is as simple and walking down the back side of the rock.

content.description:
LOWBALLLLLLLLLLLLL

Short and powerful little boulder. Start on the arete and top out in the center of the boulder.

Few different ways to try, the obvious ones are all in the V2 range
content.location: In the Decapitation area, it's the small boulder up the hill from Human Sacrifice.

content.description: Start with both hands in the undercling at the base and work up and right in the crack using a mix of hand jams and lay backing.  The crux is moving out of the crack to turn the corner towards the top of the boulder.
content.protection: A pad will do you nice.
content.location: The route is on the boulder below decapitation right off of the bottom of strube loop.

content.description: Fun moves. Start matched on the crimp, get to the large sloper in the middle of the boulder and follow the arete to the top. Crux is getting around the nose. Careful with the landing
content.protection: Sounds like the landing has been improved, so a pad or two should be fine
content.location: Located at the top of the Decapitation area. The rock is the first boulder at the top of the hill right underneath the cliffs

content.description:
Great route for warming up. Start on a good sidepull behind a tree using a foot off to the right.

Move out left to good ledges and up to an easy top out.
content.protection: Pad for peace of mind. I did some landscaping so the bottom is flatter now
content.location: Located on the boulder below Decapitation, The route is located on the left face.

content.description: Solid fat crack. Moves are easy and the route is fairly short. Super mellow route
content.protection: Perhaps a pad and a spotter.
content.location: Along the backside of Head Games, climb the obvious crack.

content.description:
Maybe 100 yards down the Strube Loop road from the Braille trail, on the right. Roadside, but not a road cut.

Start in the undercling, move to the rail, then make a huge move to the next rail. Top out is jugs. Maybe V3?
content.location: 100 yards down the road from the Braille Trail, on the right, very obvious.

content.description: A fun, short, and fairly technical problem located in the Motor Skills area next to the "O" Face. Both hands start matched in the crimp in the corner, with your foot on the bottom right. The crux is on the first move moving from the crimp, balancing to a tall, crimpy sidepull.
content.location: Start matched in the dihedral next to the "O" Face on a sharp crimp.

content.description:
Interesting holds on a buldge shaped face. Start sitting on a big sloping ledge with a foot on a good edge out right.

Bump your right hand to the small edge right above the sloper if needed, but make your way to the left and up the slopey face. Top out on the slab in between the rock
content.protection: Landing slopes downward, but logs have been placed to hold a pad in place. Fairly lowball so you don't have too much to worry about
content.location:
One of the first routes you'll see walking up to Decapitation- a great sloping face with a large overhang to the right.

Where the route starts, the landing has been a little landscaped which can easily be seen
